organization.name: Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council organized and hosted the final day of the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center and awarded the champions a 3,000-selvar development grant.

The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council granted Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly permission to use official statistics and photographs from the championship, supplied archival materials, and, through its development coordinator, clarified in the June 2025 issue that it would not produce separate case-study booklets on Grendale’s title run.

On 2025-07-03, the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council’s 3,000-selvar development grant was partially realized when Grendale Youth Futsal Academy reported using roughly two-thirds of the funds to purchase new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment and sent a formal email of thanks.

Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 became the focus of a three-part analytical feature in Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly, with its training routines, tactical structures, and pressing patterns documented in depth and subsequently used by both its own players and external coaches as a reference point.

Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s program was indirectly influenced when its coach, Harven Soll, adopted drills and concepts from the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly “Pressing in Pairs” article into his July 2025 pre-season schedule.

organization.mission_statement: To encourage participation and teamwork among students through regular futsal training and inter-school competition.

organization.name: Selvarin East Secondary Under-17
organization.description: An academically oriented secondary school's under-17 futsal team that emphasizes discipline and balanced development on and off the court.

history.event_update: Selvarin East Secondary Under-17 took part in Group A, with forward Laren Vos scoring a 6-meter penalty in their narrow 2–1 defeat to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

organization.mission_statement: To support students who wish to combine academic progress with structured futsal training at the under-17 level.

organization.name: Orvath Ridge Collegiate Under-17
organization.description: A collegiate preparatory school's under-17 futsal squad known for its emphasis on tactical understanding and fitness.

history.event_update: Orvath Ridge Collegiate Under-17 played in Group A of the championship, losing 1–0 to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 during the group stage.

organization.mission_statement: To prepare motivated student-athletes for higher-level study and competition through disciplined futsal training.

organization.name: Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17
organization.description: A privately run training center's under-17 futsal squad that draws players from multiple schools along the riverfront districts.

history.event_update: Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 reached the semifinals of the championship but were eliminated 2–1 by Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 after briefly leveling the score early in the second half.

organization.mission_statement: To deliver high-intensity futsal development programs for teenagers drawn from diverse school backgrounds.

organization.name: Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17
organization.description: A specialized sports school's under-17 futsal team that integrates intensive athletic training with standard academic studies.

history.event_update: Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17 advanced to the final at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center, where they were defeated 3–0 by Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

organization.mission_statement: To integrate specialized athletic coaching with formal education for talented young players.

organization.name: Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly
organization.description: A small regional print and digital magazine that specializes in grassroots youth sport coverage, coaching education, and local athlete profiles.

history.event_update: Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly commissioned, produced, and on 2025-06-30 released a mid-year issue featuring Lina Veress’s multi-part analysis of Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s championship campaign, distributing about 2,500 copies across Selvarin City and the Grendale Suburban Zone.

organization.mission_statement: To provide accessible, practical coverage of youth sport that supports coaches, young athletes, and families in their local communities.

location.name: Grendale Suburban Zone
location.description: A predominantly residential commuter region on the western fringe of a metropolitan area, characterized by low-rise housing estates, small shopping strips, and neighborhood parks.

history.event_update: Grendale Suburban Zone was represented at the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship by its qualifying team, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, which went on to win the title.

Grendale Suburban Zone was indirectly involved when the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly issue featuring Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 was distributed across the region and local coaches began informally using the series as a shared reference for training discussions.

On 2025-07-02–03, facilities in the Grendale Suburban Zone received the new council-funded futsal equipment and hosted Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s first low-pressure indoor training session using it.

location.name: Selvarin City
location.description: A mid-sized inland industrial and university city known for its manufacturing base, technical institutes, and active grassroots sports scene.

history.event_update: Selvarin City served as the host city for the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship, with matches held at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center and drawing local school teams and spectators.

Selvarin City hosted the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly editorial work, printing, and wide distribution of the June 2025 issue, and it was where several school futsal coaches adopted the magazine’s Grendale feature series as practical planning material.
On 2025-06-30, a Selvarin City sports supplier received the order for the new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment that would later be delivered to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy.

art.name: Pressing in Pairs
art.description: An instructional sports-coaching article that breaks down a specific defensive concept into progressive training activities for developing youth players.

history.event_update: The article “Pressing in Pairs” was published in Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s 2025-06-30 issue, presenting Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s paired pressing pattern through progressive training blocks that local coaches began integrating into their own sessions.

During the 2025-07-03 training session, head coach Marlen Tiravo reminded the squad that concepts from the article “Pressing in Pairs” would feature in upcoming work, framing the day’s activities as a technical reset before returning to those pressing ideas.

art.creator: Lina Veress

art.name: Council Perspective
art.description: A concise opinion piece that outlines key priorities and limitations in grassroots sports development from an administrative point of view.

history.event_update: The editorial note “Council Perspective” appeared in the 2025-06-30 Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly issue alongside the Grendale feature series, outlining the council’s priorities and constraints regarding official educational materials on the championship.

art.creator: Neris Dalvo

building.name: Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center
building.description: A modest multi-purpose indoor sports facility serving local clubs, schools, and community fitness activities.

history.event_update: Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center hosted all of Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17's matches, including the 2–1 semifinal and 3–0 final on the main court, using its blue synthetic futsal surface and electronic scoreboards before a crowd of about 450 for the final.

Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center’s match footage from the championship was replayed by Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly staff to extract tactical sequences that were converted into diagrams for the June 2025 feature on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

building.material: steel-and-concrete frame with insulated panels

event.name: Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship
event.description: A regional youth futsal tournament that brings together under-17 teams from surrounding districts for structured competitive play each year.

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship concluded on 2025-03-22 at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center, with Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 winning the title after a 3–0 final victory over Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17.

The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship later served as the central case study for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June 2025 analytical series, with its matches providing the statistics, photographs, and match footage used for articles and diagrams.

miscellaneous.name: selvars
miscellaneous.description: Selvars are the official fiat currency of Kerevalia, used for everyday consumer transactions and regional trade.

history.event_update: Selvars were the currency unit used for the championship budget and for the 3,000-selvar development grant awarded to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.
Selvars were referenced again in June 2025 as the currency of the 8-selvar cover price for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s mid-year issue featuring the Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 series.

By 2025-07-03, roughly two-thirds of the 3,000 selvars from the championship development grant had been spent on new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, with the remaining selvars reserved for replacements and maintenance.

miscellaneous.name: Group A
miscellaneous.description: Group A is a standard pool-based classification label commonly used to organize teams into the first preliminary group in round-robin tournaments.

history.event_update: Group A was the preliminary pool in which Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 topped the standings with three wins from three matches during the championship.

person.name: Laren Vos
person.description: A technically gifted and fiercely competitive teenager who channels his energy into structured training and careful self-improvement.

history.event_update: During the championship, Laren Vos scored Selvarin East Secondary Under-17's lone goal against Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in Group A via a 6-meter penalty.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal forward
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Ren Talvek
person.description: A calm and analytical young goalkeeper who thrives under pressure and approaches each match with meticulous preparation.

history.event_update: Ren Talvek helped backstop Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17's title run by conceding only two goals in five matches and earning player-of-the-match honors in two group-stage fixtures.

On 2025-07-03, goalkeeper Ren Talvek tested the bounce, grip, and flight of the newly purchased futsal balls in a dedicated catching and distribution block and discussed minor stance adjustments with head coach Marlen Tiravo.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal goalkeeper
person.education: upper secondary student (sports-focused program, in progress)

person.name: Daren Mol
person.description: A quick and expressive wide player who enjoys the creativity of attacking play and values close friendships with teammates.

history.event_update: Daren Mol opened the scoring for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in their 2–1 semifinal victory over Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the championship.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal winger
person.education: lower sixth-form student (general studies)

person.name: Jorin Kale
person.description: A physically strong and tactically aware teenager who relishes the responsibility of organizing play in both attack and defense.

history.event_update: Jorin Kale scored the decisive second goal for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in the semifinal, finishing a set-play corner routine to secure a 2–1 win.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal pivot
person.education: upper secondary student (business track, in progress)

person.name: Elvin Sarro
person.description: A detail-oriented official who is respected for clear communication, consistent decisions, and a commitment to educating young players about the rules.

history.event_update: Elvin Sarro officiated the high-tempo semifinal between Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 and Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship.

person.profession: physical education teacher and certified futsal referee
person.education: bachelor's degree in physical education

person.name: Mikel Ardan
person.description: A creative and outspoken teenager who naturally takes on leadership roles and enjoys studying the strategic side of sport.

history.event_update: Mikel Ardan captained Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in the final, scoring twice in a 3–0 win over Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17 to clinch the championship title.

Mikel Ardan appeared on the June 2025 cover of Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly lifting the championship trophy, and later took part in the academy’s classroom review of the feature series that highlighted his team’s off-the-ball work.
During the 2025-07-03 training session, captain Mikel Ardan helped lead the technical work by demonstrating inside-outside touch sequences for teammates in the ball-control stations.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal playmaker
person.education: upper secondary student (humanities track, in progress)

person.name: Sera Noll
person.description: A determined and hard-working young athlete who balances fast-paced sport with a strong interest in future medical studies.

history.event_update: Sera Noll added the third goal on a late fast break in the final, helping Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 secure a 3–0 victory and the tournament championship.
On 2025-07-03, flank player Sera Noll partnered with captain Mikel Ardan to demonstrate inside-outside touches before the squad repeated the pattern in the ball-control segment.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal flank player
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Marlen Tiravo
person.description: A methodical and patient coach who emphasizes discipline, collective responsibility, and long-term development over short-term results.

history.event_update: Head coach Marlen Tiravo led Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 to the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship title and received the official development-grant confirmation letter from council representatives after the final.

Head coach Marlen Tiravo participated in extended tactical and cultural interviews for the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly feature series, was prominently quoted in the “Pressing in Pairs” article, and led a classroom-style review session using the published diagrams with his under-17 squad on 2025-06-30.

On 2025-07-03, head coach Marlen Tiravo organized and led a 90-minute low-pressure indoor session introducing the new council-funded equipment, oversaw technical, agility, and finishing work, and emailed the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council to report on the grant’s initial use.

person.profession: youth futsal coach and physical education instructor
person.education: master's degree in coaching and sports pedagogy

person.name: Lina Veress
person.description: An observant and articulate communicator who enjoys crafting human-interest stories that highlight the dedication of young athletes and volunteers.

history.event_update: Lina Veress conducted the post-final courtside interview with head coach Marlen Tiravo on behalf of the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council media team.

Lina Veress was commissioned by Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly to produce a multi-part analytical feature series on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s title run, conducted in-depth interviews with head coach Marlen Tiravo, authored the “Pressing in Pairs” article, and had her work adopted by local coaches as a practical reference.

On 2025-07-12, concepts from Lina Veress’s article “Pressing in Pairs” directly shaped Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s pre-match talk, warm-up drills, in-game pressing structure, and subsequent training plans.

person.profession: sports communications officer and freelance journalist
person.education: bachelor's degree in media and communications

person.name: Ralen Ko
person.description: A meticulous and quietly driven editor who enjoys shaping long-form stories that amplify young people's experiences in sport.

history.event_update: As editor of Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly, Ralen Ko commissioned the three-part feature on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, coordinated permissions for using championship materials, and received positive informal feedback from local coaches after the issue’s 2025-06-30 release.

person.profession: magazine editor and youth sports writer
person.education: bachelor's degree in journalism

person.name: Doran Helv
person.description: A pragmatic administrator with a calm demeanor who is motivated by building clear structures and fair opportunities in community sport.

history.event_update: Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council chairperson Doran Helv authorized Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s use of official statistics and photographs from the championship through a two-page email agreement finalized on 2025-06-18.

person.profession: youth sports council chairperson
person.education: master's degree in sports administration

person.name: Hele Narm
person.description: A detail-focused visual designer who enjoys turning complex information into clean, approachable layouts for young readers.

history.event_update: Graphic designer Hele Narm transformed Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s match-analysis notes into full-page tactical diagrams and in-text sequences illustrating Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s pressing and transition patterns for the June 2025 issue.

person.profession: graphic designer and illustrator
person.education: bachelor's degree in graphic design

person.name: Harven Soll
person.description: An energetic schoolteacher and coach who values simple, well-organized training sessions and personal accountability from his players.

history.event_update: Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 coach Harven Soll used Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June 2025 feature—especially drills from “Pressing in Pairs”—as reference material, marking them for inclusion in his July pre-season training plans.

On 2025-07-12, coach Harven Soll led Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 in a “Pressing in Pairs”-inspired friendly against Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17, overseeing the warm-up, in-game adjustments, post-match feedback, arranging a second friendly, and scheduling paired-pressing blocks into late-July training.

person.profession: secondary school physical education teacher and futsal coach
person.education: bachelor's degree in physical education

person.name: Neris Dalvo
person.description: A policy-minded planner who focuses on making grassroots sport programs inclusive, sustainable, and grounded in clear developmental principles.

history.event_update: As development coordinator, Neris Dalvo contributed a “Council Perspective” note to the 2025-06-30 feature series, explaining the council’s focus on broad guidelines over team-specific case studies while praising Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s positive example.

Shortly after 17:15 on 2025-07-03, development coordinator Neris Dalvo received an email update and photos from head coach Marlen Tiravo confirming that the council-funded equipment was in use at Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

person.profession: sports development coordinator
person.education: master's degree in education policy

person.name: Kelran Dov
person.description: A methodical and encouraging fitness specialist who focuses on building long-term athletic habits through simple, well-structured routines.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-03, newly appointed Under-17 fitness coach Kelran Dov prepared and checked the new futsal balls and agility equipment, then led low-intensity ladder and mini-hurdle drills while recording movement observations.

person.profession: fitness coach and strength-and-conditioning specialist
person.education: bachelor's degree in sports science

person.name: Riven Hall
person.description: A thoughtful and disciplined teenager who enjoys the technical details of goalkeeping and quietly tracks his progress in a personal training journal.

history.event_update: During the 2025-07-12 friendly, goalkeeper Riven Hall played for Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17, conceding a single low shot to the far corner in a 1–1 draw with Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal goalkeeper
person.education: upper secondary student (general studies, in progress)

person.name: Talen Priev
person.description: An energetic and optimistic wide player who thrives on one-on-one duels and takes pride in helping teammates feel included and supported.

history.event_update: In the 2025-07-12 friendly, wide player Talen Priev scored Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s equalizer against Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 by intercepting a pass in a coordinated press and finishing with a low left-footed shot.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal winger
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Deren Kavos
person.description: A pragmatic and encouraging coach who values well-structured sessions and uses simple feedback to help adolescents build confidence on and off the court.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-12, visiting coach Deren Kavos led Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 in their 1–1 friendly at Meadowlane School, then discussed the impact of Meadowlane’s pressing, agreed to arrange a second match, and considered recording video clips for joint analysis.

organization.name: Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council
organization.description: A volunteer-led regional body that coordinates youth futsal leagues, referee development, and coach education programs.

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council organized and hosted the final day of the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center and awarded the champions a 3,000-selvar development grant.

The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council granted Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly permission to use official statistics and photographs from the championship, supplied archival materials, and, through its development coordinator, clarified in the June 2025 issue that it would not produce separate case-study booklets on Grendale’s title run.

On 2025-07-03, the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council’s 3,000-selvar development grant was partially realized when Grendale Youth Futsal Academy reported using roughly two-thirds of the funds to purchase new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment and sent a formal email of thanks.

organization.mission_statement: To develop structured futsal opportunities for school-aged players while promoting fair play, safety, and inclusion.

organization.name: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17
organization.description: An under-17 training squad that offers structured futsal development for talented adolescents from surrounding neighborhoods.

history.event_update: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 represented the Grendale Suburban Zone, went unbeaten in five matches to win the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship, and received a 3,000-selvar development grant from the council.

Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 became the focus of a three-part analytical feature in Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly, with its training routines, tactical structures, and pressing patterns documented in depth and subsequently used by both its own players and external coaches as a reference point.

On 2025-07-03, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 held a 90-minute technical reset session with 11 attendees, introduced the new grant-funded equipment, and worked under an expanded staff that now includes fitness coach Kelran Dov.

organization.mission_statement: To provide advanced futsal coaching and life-skills education for promising players in the under-17 age group.

organization.name: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy
organization.description: A community-based futsal academy providing age-tiered technical and tactical instruction for players from early childhood through late adolescence.

history.event_update: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy's under-17 squad, coached by long-time academy staff member Marlen Tiravo, captured the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship title.

Grendale Youth Futsal Academy hosted in-person interviews for the magazine feature at its office and a classroom review session on 2025-06-30, where the under-17 squad studied diagrams and passages from the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly series overlooking the academy’s indoor court.

In early July 2025, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy purchased and received new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment with its development grant funds, set them up on the indoor court for the Under-17s’ 2025-07-03 session, and served as the base from which head coach Marlen Tiravo sent the council his grant-use update.

event.name: Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship
event.description: A regional youth futsal tournament that brings together under-17 teams from surrounding districts for structured competitive play each year.

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship concluded on 2025-03-22 at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center, with Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 winning the title after a 3–0 final victory over Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17.

The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship later served as the central case study for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June 2025 analytical series, with its matches providing the statistics, photographs, and match footage used for articles and diagrams.

miscellaneous.name: selvars
miscellaneous.description: Selvars are the official fiat currency of Kerevalia, used for everyday consumer transactions and regional trade.

history.event_update: Selvars were the currency unit used for the championship budget and for the 3,000-selvar development grant awarded to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.
Selvars were referenced again in June 2025 as the currency of the 8-selvar cover price for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s mid-year issue featuring the Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 series.

By 2025-07-03, roughly two-thirds of the 3,000 selvars from the championship development grant had been spent on new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, with the remaining selvars reserved for replacements and maintenance.

miscellaneous.name: Group A
miscellaneous.description: Group A is a standard pool-based classification label commonly used to organize teams into the first preliminary group in round-robin tournaments.

history.event_update: Group A was the preliminary pool in which Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 topped the standings with three wins from three matches during the championship.

person.name: Laren Vos
person.description: A technically gifted and fiercely competitive teenager who channels his energy into structured training and careful self-improvement.

history.event_update: During the championship, Laren Vos scored Selvarin East Secondary Under-17's lone goal against Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in Group A via a 6-meter penalty.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal forward
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Ren Talvek
person.description: A calm and analytical young goalkeeper who thrives under pressure and approaches each match with meticulous preparation.

history.event_update: Ren Talvek helped backstop Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17's title run by conceding only two goals in five matches and earning player-of-the-match honors in two group-stage fixtures.

On 2025-07-03, goalkeeper Ren Talvek tested the bounce, grip, and flight of the newly purchased futsal balls in a dedicated catching and distribution block and discussed minor stance adjustments with head coach Marlen Tiravo.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal goalkeeper
person.education: upper secondary student (sports-focused program, in progress)

person.name: Daren Mol
person.description: A quick and expressive wide player who enjoys the creativity of attacking play and values close friendships with teammates.

history.event_update: Daren Mol opened the scoring for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in their 2–1 semifinal victory over Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the championship.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal winger
person.education: lower sixth-form student (general studies)

person.name: Jorin Kale
person.description: A physically strong and tactically aware teenager who relishes the responsibility of organizing play in both attack and defense.

history.event_update: Jorin Kale scored the decisive second goal for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in the semifinal, finishing a set-play corner routine to secure a 2–1 win.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal pivot
person.education: upper secondary student (business track, in progress)

person.name: Elvin Sarro
person.description: A detail-oriented official who is respected for clear communication, consistent decisions, and a commitment to educating young players about the rules.

history.event_update: Elvin Sarro officiated the high-tempo semifinal between Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 and Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship.

person.profession: physical education teacher and certified futsal referee
person.education: bachelor's degree in physical education

person.name: Mikel Ardan
person.description: A creative and outspoken teenager who naturally takes on leadership roles and enjoys studying the strategic side of sport.

history.event_update: Mikel Ardan captained Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in the final, scoring twice in a 3–0 win over Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17 to clinch the championship title.

Mikel Ardan appeared on the June 2025 cover of Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly lifting the championship trophy, and later took part in the academy’s classroom review of the feature series that highlighted his team’s off-the-ball work.
During the 2025-07-03 training session, captain Mikel Ardan helped lead the technical work by demonstrating inside-outside touch sequences for teammates in the ball-control stations.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal playmaker
person.education: upper secondary student (humanities track, in progress)

person.name: Sera Noll
person.description: A determined and hard-working young athlete who balances fast-paced sport with a strong interest in future medical studies.

history.event_update: Sera Noll added the third goal on a late fast break in the final, helping Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 secure a 3–0 victory and the tournament championship.
On 2025-07-03, flank player Sera Noll partnered with captain Mikel Ardan to demonstrate inside-outside touches before the squad repeated the pattern in the ball-control segment.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal flank player
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Marlen Tiravo
person.description: A methodical and patient coach who emphasizes discipline, collective responsibility, and long-term development over short-term results.

history.event_update: Head coach Marlen Tiravo led Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 to the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship title and received the official development-grant confirmation letter from council representatives after the final.

Head coach Marlen Tiravo participated in extended tactical and cultural interviews for the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly feature series, was prominently quoted in the “Pressing in Pairs” article, and led a classroom-style review session using the published diagrams with his under-17 squad on 2025-06-30.

On 2025-07-03, head coach Marlen Tiravo organized and led a 90-minute low-pressure indoor session introducing the new council-funded equipment, oversaw technical, agility, and finishing work, and emailed the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council to report on the grant’s initial use.

person.profession: youth futsal coach and physical education instructor
person.education: master's degree in coaching and sports pedagogy

person.name: Lina Veress
person.description: An observant and articulate communicator who enjoys crafting human-interest stories that highlight the dedication of young athletes and volunteers.

history.event_update: Lina Veress conducted the post-final courtside interview with head coach Marlen Tiravo on behalf of the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council media team.

Lina Veress was commissioned by Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly to produce a multi-part analytical feature series on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s title run, conducted in-depth interviews with head coach Marlen Tiravo, authored the “Pressing in Pairs” article, and had her work adopted by local coaches as a practical reference.

On 2025-07-12, concepts from Lina Veress’s article “Pressing in Pairs” directly shaped Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s pre-match talk, warm-up drills, in-game pressing structure, and subsequent training plans.

person.profession: sports communications officer and freelance journalist
person.education: bachelor's degree in media and communications

person.name: Ralen Ko
person.description: A meticulous and quietly driven editor who enjoys shaping long-form stories that amplify young people's experiences in sport.

history.event_update: As editor of Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly, Ralen Ko commissioned the three-part feature on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, coordinated permissions for using championship materials, and received positive informal feedback from local coaches after the issue’s 2025-06-30 release.

person.profession: magazine editor and youth sports writer
person.education: bachelor's degree in journalism

person.name: Doran Helv
person.description: A pragmatic administrator with a calm demeanor who is motivated by building clear structures and fair opportunities in community sport.

history.event_update: Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council chairperson Doran Helv authorized Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s use of official statistics and photographs from the championship through a two-page email agreement finalized on 2025-06-18.

person.profession: youth sports council chairperson
person.education: master's degree in sports administration

person.name: Hele Narm
person.description: A detail-focused visual designer who enjoys turning complex information into clean, approachable layouts for young readers.

history.event_update: Graphic designer Hele Narm transformed Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s match-analysis notes into full-page tactical diagrams and in-text sequences illustrating Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s pressing and transition patterns for the June 2025 issue.

person.profession: graphic designer and illustrator
person.education: bachelor's degree in graphic design

person.name: Harven Soll
person.description: An energetic schoolteacher and coach who values simple, well-organized training sessions and personal accountability from his players.

history.event_update: Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 coach Harven Soll used Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June 2025 feature—especially drills from “Pressing in Pairs”—as reference material, marking them for inclusion in his July pre-season training plans.

On 2025-07-12, coach Harven Soll led Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 in a “Pressing in Pairs”-inspired friendly against Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17, overseeing the warm-up, in-game adjustments, post-match feedback, arranging a second friendly, and scheduling paired-pressing blocks into late-July training.

On 2025-07-24, coach Harven Soll co-inspected the wet futsal court at Northline Community Sports Hall, helped mark off a no-entry zone, redesigned the afternoon’s plan into joint pressing-focused drills and a mixed-squad game, led parts of the warm-up and feedback, reviewed Ravelin VX-2 camcorder footage with players, and agreed arrangements for video sharing and an August rematch.

person.profession: secondary school physical education teacher and futsal coach
person.education: bachelor's degree in physical education

person.name: Neris Dalvo
person.description: A policy-minded planner who focuses on making grassroots sport programs inclusive, sustainable, and grounded in clear developmental principles.

history.event_update: As development coordinator, Neris Dalvo contributed a “Council Perspective” note to the 2025-06-30 feature series, explaining the council’s focus on broad guidelines over team-specific case studies while praising Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s positive example.

Shortly after 17:15 on 2025-07-03, development coordinator Neris Dalvo received an email update and photos from head coach Marlen Tiravo confirming that the council-funded equipment was in use at Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

person.profession: sports development coordinator
person.education: master's degree in education policy

person.name: Kelran Dov
person.description: A methodical and encouraging fitness specialist who focuses on building long-term athletic habits through simple, well-structured routines.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-03, newly appointed Under-17 fitness coach Kelran Dov prepared and checked the new futsal balls and agility equipment, then led low-intensity ladder and mini-hurdle drills while recording movement observations.

person.profession: fitness coach and strength-and-conditioning specialist
person.education: bachelor's degree in sports science

person.name: Riven Hall
person.description: A thoughtful and disciplined teenager who enjoys the technical details of goalkeeping and quietly tracks his progress in a personal training journal.

history.event_update: During the 2025-07-12 friendly, goalkeeper Riven Hall played for Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17, conceding a single low shot to the far corner in a 1–1 draw with Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal goalkeeper
person.education: upper secondary student (general studies, in progress)

person.name: Talen Priev
person.description: An energetic and optimistic wide player who thrives on one-on-one duels and takes pride in helping teammates feel included and supported.

history.event_update: In the 2025-07-12 friendly, wide player Talen Priev scored Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s equalizer against Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 by intercepting a pass in a coordinated press and finishing with a low left-footed shot.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal winger
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Deren Kavos
person.description: A pragmatic and encouraging coach who values well-structured sessions and uses simple feedback to help adolescents build confidence on and off the court.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-12, visiting coach Deren Kavos led Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 in their 1–1 friendly at Meadowlane School, then discussed the impact of Meadowlane’s pressing, agreed to arrange a second match, and considered recording video clips for joint analysis.

On 2025-07-24, coach Deren Kavos identified the roof leak at Northline Community Sports Hall with his players, coordinated with Harven Soll to shorten the court and emphasize “Pressing in Pairs” work, set up and checked the Ravelin VX-2 camcorder for recording, guided joint pressing drills and substitutions in the mixed-squad game, reviewed a key clip post-session, and proposed the early-August rematch at Varlen Crest Training Hall.

person.profession: youth futsal coach and community recreation organizer
person.education: bachelor's degree in sports coaching

organization.name: Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council
organization.description: A volunteer-led regional body that coordinates youth futsal leagues, referee development, and coach education programs.

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council organized and hosted the final day of the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center and awarded the champions a 3,000-selvar development grant.

The Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council granted Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly permission to use official statistics and photographs from the championship, supplied archival materials, and, through its development coordinator, clarified in the June 2025 issue that it would not produce separate case-study booklets on Grendale’s title run.

On 2025-07-03, the Orvath Ridge Schools Futsal Council’s 3,000-selvar development grant was partially realized when Grendale Youth Futsal Academy reported using roughly two-thirds of the funds to purchase new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment and sent a formal email of thanks.

organization.mission_statement: To develop structured futsal opportunities for school-aged players while promoting fair play, safety, and inclusion.

organization.name: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17
organization.description: An under-17 training squad that offers structured futsal development for talented adolescents from surrounding neighborhoods.

history.event_update: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 represented the Grendale Suburban Zone, went unbeaten in five matches to win the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship, and received a 3,000-selvar development grant from the council.

Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 became the focus of a three-part analytical feature in Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly, with its training routines, tactical structures, and pressing patterns documented in depth and subsequently used by both its own players and external coaches as a reference point.

On 2025-07-03, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 held a 90-minute technical reset session with 11 attendees, introduced the new grant-funded equipment, and worked under an expanded staff that now includes fitness coach Kelran Dov.

organization.mission_statement: To provide advanced futsal coaching and life-skills education for promising players in the under-17 age group.

organization.name: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy
organization.description: A community-based futsal academy providing age-tiered technical and tactical instruction for players from early childhood through late adolescence.

history.event_update: Grendale Youth Futsal Academy's under-17 squad, coached by long-time academy staff member Marlen Tiravo, captured the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship title.

Grendale Youth Futsal Academy hosted in-person interviews for the magazine feature at its office and a classroom review session on 2025-06-30, where the under-17 squad studied diagrams and passages from the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly series overlooking the academy’s indoor court.

In early July 2025, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy purchased and received new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment with its development grant funds, set them up on the indoor court for the Under-17s’ 2025-07-03 session, and served as the base from which head coach Marlen Tiravo sent the council his grant-use update.

organization.mission_statement: To make structured futsal training accessible to children and teenagers through affordable programs and community partnerships.

organization.name: Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17
organization.description: A school-based futsal program that fields an under-17 squad focused on participation, teamwork, and basic competitive experience.

history.event_update: Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 competed in Group A of the championship, where they lost 3–0 to eventual winners Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s program was indirectly influenced when its coach, Harven Soll, adopted drills and concepts from the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly “Pressing in Pairs” article into his July 2025 pre-season schedule.

On 2025-07-12, Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 hosted Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 for a 1–1 pre-season friendly in which they implemented “Pressing in Pairs” ideas, trialed paired pressing drills, and committed to continuing that work in upcoming July training sessions.

On 2025-07-24, Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 traveled to Northline Community Sports Hall for a planned pre-season rematch with Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 but instead took part in a shortened-court joint session featuring paired-pressing drills, a twelve-minute mixed-squad training game, and arrangements for shared video review and an August rematch at Varlen Crest Training Hall.

organization.mission_statement: To encourage participation and teamwork among students through regular futsal training and inter-school competition.

organization.name: Selvarin East Secondary Under-17
organization.description: An academically oriented secondary school's under-17 futsal team that emphasizes discipline and balanced development on and off the court.

history.event_update: Selvarin East Secondary Under-17 took part in Group A, with forward Laren Vos scoring a 6-meter penalty in their narrow 2–1 defeat to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

organization.mission_statement: To support students who wish to combine academic progress with structured futsal training at the under-17 level.

organization.name: Orvath Ridge Collegiate Under-17
organization.description: A collegiate preparatory school's under-17 futsal squad known for its emphasis on tactical understanding and fitness.

history.event_update: Orvath Ridge Collegiate Under-17 played in Group A of the championship, losing 1–0 to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 during the group stage.

organization.mission_statement: To prepare motivated student-athletes for higher-level study and competition through disciplined futsal training.

organization.name: Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17
organization.description: A privately run training center's under-17 futsal squad that draws players from multiple schools along the riverfront districts.

history.event_update: Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 reached the semifinals of the championship but were eliminated 2–1 by Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 after briefly leveling the score early in the second half.

organization.mission_statement: To deliver high-intensity futsal development programs for teenagers drawn from diverse school backgrounds.

organization.name: Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17
organization.description: A specialized sports school's under-17 futsal team that integrates intensive athletic training with standard academic studies.

history.event_update: Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17 advanced to the final at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center, where they were defeated 3–0 by Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

organization.mission_statement: To integrate specialized athletic coaching with formal education for talented young players.

organization.name: Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly
organization.description: A small regional print and digital magazine that specializes in grassroots youth sport coverage, coaching education, and local athlete profiles.

history.event_update: Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly commissioned, produced, and on 2025-06-30 released a mid-year issue featuring Lina Veress’s multi-part analysis of Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s championship campaign, distributing about 2,500 copies across Selvarin City and the Grendale Suburban Zone.

By 2025-07-12, Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June issue and the article “Pressing in Pairs” were actively being used by Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 as tactical reference material for their friendly and late-July training plans.

organization.mission_statement: To provide accessible, practical coverage of youth sport that supports coaches, young athletes, and families in their local communities.

organization.name: Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17
organization.description: An independent youth futsal squad that offers structured training and regular competition for under-17 players drawn from several nearby schools.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-12, Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 traveled to Meadowlane School for a pre-season friendly, took a 1–0 lead via a right-sided counterattack, and finished with a 1–1 draw while being pushed into more long passes by Meadowlane’s adjusted pressing.

On 2025-07-24, Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 arrived at Northline Community Sports Hall for a scheduled full-length rematch with Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17, then adapted to the roof leak by contributing cones, players, and a Ravelin VX-2 camcorder to a joint pressing-focused training session and mixed-squad game, while agreeing to share footage and host the rearranged rematch at Varlen Crest Training Hall in early August.

organization.mission_statement: To develop technically competent, tactically aware young futsal players within a positive and disciplined club environment.

location.name: Grendale Suburban Zone
location.description: A predominantly residential commuter region on the western fringe of a metropolitan area, characterized by low-rise housing estates, small shopping strips, and neighborhood parks.

history.event_update: Grendale Suburban Zone was represented at the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship by its qualifying team, Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, which went on to win the title.

Grendale Suburban Zone was indirectly involved when the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly issue featuring Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 was distributed across the region and local coaches began informally using the series as a shared reference for training discussions.

On 2025-07-02–03, facilities in the Grendale Suburban Zone received the new council-funded futsal equipment and hosted Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s first low-pressure indoor training session using it.

location.name: Selvarin City
location.description: A mid-sized inland industrial and university city known for its manufacturing base, technical institutes, and active grassroots sports scene.

history.event_update: Selvarin City served as the host city for the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship, with matches held at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center and drawing local school teams and spectators.

Selvarin City hosted the Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly editorial work, printing, and wide distribution of the June 2025 issue, and it was where several school futsal coaches adopted the magazine’s Grendale feature series as practical planning material.
On 2025-06-30, a Selvarin City sports supplier received the order for the new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment that would later be delivered to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy.

On 2025-07-12, Selvarin City was the setting for Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s 1–1 pre-season friendly against Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 at Meadowlane School’s indoor court in the Meadowlane Quarter.

On 2025-07-24, Selvarin City again served as the setting for youth futsal activity when Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 used Northline Community Sports Hall for a modified joint training session after a roof leak prevented their planned full rematch.

location.name: Meadowlane Quarter
location.description: A mixed residential and school-focused urban district characterized by mid-rise apartment blocks, small commercial streets, and several compact green spaces.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-12, the Meadowlane Quarter hosted the indoor futsal friendly between Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17, with local spectators in the bleachers and coach Harven Soll later updating his training plans at his kitchen table in the district.

product.name: Ravelin VX-2 camcorder
product.description: A mid-range handheld digital camcorder designed for reliable recording of amateur sports, school events, and everyday video in high definition.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-24, the Ravelin VX-2 camcorder was used at Northline Community Sports Hall on a fixed tripod to record Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17’s joint paired-pressing drills and mixed-squad game, with coaches reviewing a brief clip on its screen and planning to share the full video file for later analysis.

art.name: Pressing in Pairs
art.description: An instructional sports-coaching article that breaks down a specific defensive concept into progressive training activities for developing youth players.

history.event_update: The article “Pressing in Pairs” was published in Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s 2025-06-30 issue, presenting Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17’s paired pressing pattern through progressive training blocks that local coaches began integrating into their own sessions.

During the 2025-07-03 training session, head coach Marlen Tiravo reminded the squad that concepts from the article “Pressing in Pairs” would feature in upcoming work, framing the day’s activities as a technical reset before returning to those pressing ideas.

On 2025-07-12, the article “Pressing in Pairs” guided Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17’s pre-match meeting, paired pressing shadow drill, in-game defensive structure, and the scheduling of recurring defensive blocks in their late-July training plan.

On 2025-07-24, the article “Pressing in Pairs” again shaped training design as coaches at Northline Community Sports Hall based joint paired-pressing drills, defender cues, and the scoring focus of a mixed-squad game for Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 on its concepts.

art.creator: Lina Veress

art.name: Council Perspective
art.description: A concise opinion piece that outlines key priorities and limitations in grassroots sports development from an administrative point of view.

history.event_update: The editorial note “Council Perspective” appeared in the 2025-06-30 Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly issue alongside the Grendale feature series, outlining the council’s priorities and constraints regarding official educational materials on the championship.

art.creator: Neris Dalvo

building.name: Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center
building.description: A modest multi-purpose indoor sports facility serving local clubs, schools, and community fitness activities.

history.event_update: Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center hosted all of Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17's matches, including the 2–1 semifinal and 3–0 final on the main court, using its blue synthetic futsal surface and electronic scoreboards before a crowd of about 450 for the final.

Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center’s match footage from the championship was replayed by Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly staff to extract tactical sequences that were converted into diagrams for the June 2025 feature on Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.

building.material: steel-and-concrete frame with insulated panels

building.name: Northline Community Sports Hall
building.description: A municipally operated indoor sports hall that offers bookable court space for recreation leagues, school activities, and neighborhood fitness programs.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-24, Northline Community Sports Hall hosted Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17’s planned rematch, but a recurring roof leak that created a wet patch near one goal led coaches to cordon off a third of the futsal court with cones and run a reduced-length joint training session, including recorded pressing drills and a short mixed-squad game, before coaches reviewed video and confirmed plans for a future rematch elsewhere.

building.material: steel frame with insulated metal panels and glazed end walls

building.name: Varlen Crest Training Hall
building.description: A privately managed indoor training hall specializing in small-sided court sports and structured coaching sessions for youth and adult groups.

history.event_update: On 2025-07-24, Varlen Crest Training Hall was selected and scheduled as the safer alternative venue for an early-August full rematch between Meadowlane School Futsal Under-17 and Varlen Crest Futsal Club Under-17 after the roof leak at Northline Community Sports Hall cut short their original plans.

building.material: laminated timber arches with composite cladding and sprung sports flooring

event.name: Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship
event.description: A regional youth futsal tournament that brings together under-17 teams from surrounding districts for structured competitive play each year.

history.event_update: The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship concluded on 2025-03-22 at Selvarin Orvath Indoor Center, with Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 winning the title after a 3–0 final victory over Selvarin Central Sports School Under-17.

The Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship later served as the central case study for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s June 2025 analytical series, with its matches providing the statistics, photographs, and match footage used for articles and diagrams.

miscellaneous.name: selvars
miscellaneous.description: Selvars are the official fiat currency of Kerevalia, used for everyday consumer transactions and regional trade.

history.event_update: Selvars were the currency unit used for the championship budget and for the 3,000-selvar development grant awarded to Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17.
Selvars were referenced again in June 2025 as the currency of the 8-selvar cover price for Selvarin Youth Sport Quarterly’s mid-year issue featuring the Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 series.

By 2025-07-03, roughly two-thirds of the 3,000 selvars from the championship development grant had been spent on new futsal balls, portable goals, and agility equipment for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17, with the remaining selvars reserved for replacements and maintenance.

miscellaneous.name: Group A
miscellaneous.description: Group A is a standard pool-based classification label commonly used to organize teams into the first preliminary group in round-robin tournaments.

history.event_update: Group A was the preliminary pool in which Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 topped the standings with three wins from three matches during the championship.

person.name: Laren Vos
person.description: A technically gifted and fiercely competitive teenager who channels his energy into structured training and careful self-improvement.

history.event_update: During the championship, Laren Vos scored Selvarin East Secondary Under-17's lone goal against Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in Group A via a 6-meter penalty.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal forward
person.education: upper secondary student (science track, in progress)

person.name: Ren Talvek
person.description: A calm and analytical young goalkeeper who thrives under pressure and approaches each match with meticulous preparation.

history.event_update: Ren Talvek helped backstop Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17's title run by conceding only two goals in five matches and earning player-of-the-match honors in two group-stage fixtures.

On 2025-07-03, goalkeeper Ren Talvek tested the bounce, grip, and flight of the newly purchased futsal balls in a dedicated catching and distribution block and discussed minor stance adjustments with head coach Marlen Tiravo.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal goalkeeper

person.name: Daren Mol

history.event_update: Daren Mol opened the scoring for Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 in their 2–1 semifinal victory over Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the championship.

person.profession: secondary school student and youth futsal pivot

person.name: Elvin Sarro
person.description: A detail-oriented official who is respected for clear communication, consistent decisions, and a commitment to educating young players about the rules.

history.event_update: Elvin Sarro officiated the high-tempo semifinal between Grendale Youth Futsal Academy Under-17 and Selvarin Riverside Training Center Under-17 at the Orvath Ridge Under-17 Futsal Championship.

person.profession: physical education teacher and certified futsal referee
